{"step_by_step_thinking": "The apical foramen is the opening at the tip of the root apex through which nerves and blood vessels enter the tooth. In a normal tooth, the apical foramen is typically located at the center of the root apex. However, in some cases, the apical foramen may be offcenter, meaning it is not located exactly in the center. To determine the range of offcenter position, we need to consider the potential choices provided. Let's evaluate each choice:", "answer_choice": "D. 1.5-3 mm"}
